item.title: Justice for Mac Miller: The Aftermath of His Unfortunate Death
item.description:
Mac Miller was a young rapper with a unique style of rap who took the music industry by storm.  After being featured in XXL’s “Freshman Class” list with Kendrick Lamar and Meek Mill, Mac was signed to a label, collaborated with other top musicians, and ultimately released 6 studio albums.  Sadly, Mac Miller also struggled with substance abuse issues, which ultimately led to his untimely death after he suffered a fatal overdose from taking what he thought were oxycodone pills but actually contained fentanyl. Tune in as we discuss the aftermath following Mac's death, including the lawsuits against his drug dealers.

item.title: A$AP Rocky Brawlin' in the Streets & Fightin' in Court
item.description:
A$AP Rocky is more than just Rihanna’s baby daddy! He is a critically acclaimed rapper and fashionista. But, he also happens to have a number of legal issues, especially when it comes to fighting people in the streets. He’s been charged with assault several times, with one incident landing him in a Swedish jail and another ending in him being arrested at LAX after vacationing with Rihanna. Tune in as we break down all of his assault charges.

item.title: Blac Chyna’s Courtroom Showdown with the Kardashians
item.description:
Blac Chyna’s big break came when she’s discovered at a strip club by Drake. She’d go on to star in music videos, date Tyga and become friends with the Kardashians. But after Tyga leaves her for Kylie Jenner, Chyna ends up engaged to Rob Kardashian, lands herself a show on E! called “Rob & Chyna” and gives birth to their daughter Dream. But their relationship was more like a nightmare. After a night of partying ends with Rob accusing Chyna of trying to strangle him and pointing a gun to his head, they break up and E! cancels their show. Chyna denies Rob’s accusations, claims the Kardashian-Jenners conspired against her to cancel the show and sues them for over $100M. Tune in as we break it all down!

item.title: Johnny Depp & Amber Heard Defamation Lawsuits
item.description:
Johnny Depp and Amber Heard married in 2015 but just a year later, Amber filed for divorce and got a temporary restraining order against him, accusing him of being physically and verbally abusive. Luckily, they reached a divorce settlement but the harmony didn’t last long. Just two years later in 2018, Amber wrote an Op-Ed for the Washington Post about her experience as a victim of abuse. Though Amber never mentioned Johnny specifically, many thought the article was about him and just a year later, Johnny sued Amber for defamation for $50M. Amber then countersued Johnny for $100M. Now, the details of their personal lives are being exposed to the entire world. But what are these lawsuits really about and who is likely to win? Tune in to hear Alexa and Nicole break it all down.

item.title: All Falls Down: Kanye West + Kim Kardashian’s Divorce
item.description:
There have been few couples as famous as Kanye West and Kim Kardashian.  They had a whirlwind romance that included a baseball stadium proposal, an Italian wedding, the birth of 4 children, front row seats at the biggest fashion shows, over-the-top concerts, and so much more.  But, sometimes good things come to an end, and these two are currently working through a high-profile and expensive divorce.  Tune in to hear about where things stand with the split of Kimye!

item.title: That’s F*cked Up: Florida’s Don’t Say Gay Bill
item.description:
Just last month, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis signed the “Parental Rights in Education” bill aka the infamous “Don’t Say Gay” bill. Proponents claim it’s meant to give parents more control over what their children learn in school. Opponents say it’s actually a targeted attack against the LGBTQ+ community. But what does the bill actually say and what are the implications? Tune in to hear Nicole and Alexa break it all down.

item.title: Akon Owes Millions But Plans to Build $6BN "Phallic" City in Senegal?
item.description:
Akon was once known for being one of the biggest pop stars and producers in the world, and he may have even been the one to discover Lady Gaga.  After a good run in the music industry, Akon shifted his sights over to business, including plans to build a $6BN city in Senegal called “Akon City”, meant to be a real life “Wakanda” - an oasis for the Senegalese (except the buildings are pretty phallic-shaped if you ask us). But after years of planning, no city has been built and many question his intentions. Now, his former business partner and best friend is suing him for millions and calling “Akon City” a Ponzi scheme. Oh and the IRS is after him too. Tune in as we break it all down!

item.title: Naya Rivera’s Family Sues for Wrongful Death After Her “Accidental Drowning”
item.description:
Naya Rivera received critical acclaim for portraying the bad ass lesbian cheerleader “Santana Lopez” on the popular TV show “Glee”. With a promising career ahead of her, the world was shocked to learn of her untimely death at just 32 years old. What was supposed to be a fun boating trip on a lake with her 4-year old son Josey sadly ended in her accidental drowning. On behalf of their son and Naya’s estate, Naya’s ex-husband, Ryan Dorsey, sued multiple defendants, including Ventura County, for her wrongful death. Tune in as we break down the claims.

item.title: Chris Brown Sued for Millions After Dog Attacks Housekeeper
item.description:
While Chris Brown has enjoyed a lot of commercial success, with some even referring to him as the “King of R&B”, he’s had many run-ins with the law. From his assault on Rihanna back in 2009, to fighting with Frank Ocean and fans trying to take pictures with him, Chris has been charged with assault and battery many times over. However, his latest lawsuit comes from his housekeepers, one of whom was viciously attacked and mauled by Chris’ dog Hades. Tune in to hear the Legally Judgy co-hosts break down Chris’ legal issues.

item.title: Anna “Delvey” Sorokin: From Scamming Friends, Banks & Hotels to Netflix?
item.description:
Anna Delvey aka Anna Sorokin grew up in a modest Russian household but always dreamt of living a grandiose and lavish lifestyle. Upon moving to NYC and holding herself out to be a wealthy German heiress, she conned whoever she could to keep up the facade. Her luck ran out when she was sentenced to prison for her crimes. Or did it? Netflix heard about her story and offered her $320k to make a series about her. But how? Tune in to hear all about Anna’s cons and how Netflix cash helped her get out of trouble.

item.title: Katy Perry Rides On Dark Horse to Battle Nuns Over Convent
item.description:
Katy Perry is one of the best selling musicians in the world, the most followed woman on Twitter and the only known pop star to be tusslin’ with some nuns. It all began in 2014 when Katy tried to buy a convent that had been the home to a group of nuns for over 40 years. The nuns didn’t want to sell to Katy but the Archdiocese of LA did. So who owned the property and had the right to sell it? Tune in as we break down the bitter battle between Katy Perry and the Archdiocese, on the one hand, and a group of nuns and a restauranteur, on the other.

Click the link to see pictures of the convent: https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lifestyle/real-estate/inside-katy-perry-convent-sparked-a-real-estate-war-1247527/

item.title: Taylor Swift Can’t Shake This Copyright Lawsuit Off
item.description:
Since 2015, Taylor Swift has been battling numerous lawsuits against her 2014 hit single “Shake It Off”. Tune in as Nicole and Alexa break down the complicated lawsuits with sass and wit!

item.title: Cardi B Takes Down Celebrity Gossip YouTuber in Court

Cardi B won a monumental multi-million dollar defamation lawsuit against celebrity gossip YouTuber Tasha K. Tasha made numerous videos accusing Cardi of using drugs, having STI’s and even said Cardi’s daughter Kulture would have “intellectual disabilities” due to Cardi’s lifestyle. So, Cardi took her to court. Tune in to hear about the lawsuit and Cardi’s victory!

item.title: Lisa Vanderpump’s Life After RHOBH is Full of Class Action Lawsuits
item.description:
Lisa Vanderpump is arguably one of the most famous and successful of Bravo’s Real Housewives (even if she’s no longer a Housewife). But, what’s a little success without a few lawsuits? After years of owning multiple businesses, including 30+ restaurants and starting a non-profit dog rescue, Lisa is finding herself at the center of several class action lawsuits brought against her by former employees alleging various violations of California labor law, along with a lawsuit against her dog rescue center. Tune in as we break it all down!

item.title: Zayn Malik, Gigi Hadid and Yolanda Hadid: An Unraveled Modern Family
item.description:
For the past few years, Zayn Malik and Gigi Hadid have been one of Hollywood’s “it couples”, especially after they welcomed their daughter Khai.  However, things unfortunately took a turn when Zayn and Gigi’s mom, Yolanda Hadid, allegedly got into an altercation while Gigi was traveling, resulting in Zayn pleading guilty to 4 counts of harassment against the Hadids and a security guard. But did he do it? Tune in to hear about everything we know and where things stand now!

item.title: Travis Scott and the Legal Fallout from the Astroworld Festival Tragedy
item.description:
After a seemingly quick rise to fame, there was no denying the star power of Travis Scott and his loyal base of energetic young fans. However, after the 2021 Astroworld Festival resulted in hundreds of injuries and even the deaths of multiple concertgoers, Travis is now entangled in many lawsuits and will likely be sidelined for a while.  Tune is as we break down what happened and the ensuing lawsuits.

Rest in power: Mirza Baig, 27; Rodolfo Peña, 23; Madison Dubiski, 23; Franco Patiño, 21; Jacob Jurinke, 20; Axel Acosta Avila, 21; Brianna Rodriguez, 16;  John Hilgert, 14; Bharti Shahani, 22; and Ezra Blount, 9.

item.title: Pepa (of Salt-N-Pepa) Sues Plastic Surgeon Over Botched Butt Surgery
item.description:
Salt-N-Pepa is a legendary rap group that paved the way for many female rappers.  After years of producing successful albums, they temporarily disbanded and even faced a lawsuit by one of their own members, only to come out on the other side and continue making music. But, will it soon come to an end? Pepa is suing Uber after a bad car accident left her with many injuries and is now suing a Beverly Hills plastic surgeon over botched surgeries that make it hard for her to perform.  Tune in to hear it all!

Real Housewife of Salt Lake City’s very own Jen Shah portrayed herself as one of the richest and most lavish housewives, complete with a multi million dollar ski chalet where she threw “Gatsby-like” parties. item.title: End of Season 1: All of the Updates You Need
item.description:
After a season full of crazy legal issues with your favorite celebrities, we had to come back with some updates before we go on summer schedule! Check it out.
 
Show notes: On Monday, July 26, Britney Spears' new attorney Mathew Rosengart filed a motion to remove Jamie Spears as conservator and replace him with Jason Rubin, a certified public accountant who, according to his firm's website, has experience managing trust portfolios worth more than $35 million.  Britney is not waiving her right to terminate the conservatorship.

item.title: Taylor Swift Fearless(ly) Re-records Old Albums to Take Scooter Braun Out

item.title: Dolce & Gabbana's Undoing: Diet Prada or Racism?
item.description:
Dolce & Gabbana has spent years in hot water for problematic statements and marketing campaigns, but this time, with the help of Diet Prada, people outside of the fashion community finally took note. In 2018, Diet Prada was instrumental in bringing D&G’s wildly racist ad to light, but unfortunately, found themselves in court after D&G sued them over a cancelled fashion show and lost revenue. Tune in to find out more!

* Episode Note: While Dapper Dan was already working for Gucci when the blackface sweater came out, it seems like they increased his presence afterwards.

item.title: Girardi Family Values
item.description:
What do you get when you combine a prestigious attorney, Tom Girardi, and a Real Housewives of Beverly Hills star, Erika Jayne? A classic Hollywood tale of the wealthy elite living in luxury until salacious allegations of fraud, embezzlement and contentious divorce proceedings come to light and shred the fairy tale to pieces.

*Show notes/corrections: Erika purportedly spent upwards of $40k/month, not $40k/day on her glam squad.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/LegallyJudgy
